title: The Lord Peter Wimsey Mystery Collection
description:
Audio Books : Mystery and Suspense : MP3/64Kbps : English


All are unabridged narrations from CDs (except #10 which is decent quality from cassettes). All were patiently collected and ripped by peterg23.
All are recorded at 64 kbps / 44 kHz Mono CBR Fraunhofer - except #10 which is 32kbps / 22 kHz Mono CBR.


All are narrated by Ian Carmichael - except for #7 which is by Patrick Malahide.
(No unabridged CD version of #10 "Murder Must Advertise" read by Ian Carmichael has yet been released to my knowledge).



* This unique and wonderful series (read by the late great Ian Carmichael) was the first thing I posted (mostly cassette versions) when I joined Demonoid back in April 2008, here is the complete set ~ all 15 titles from CD (nearly).
This superb set read by Ian Carmichael is my all time favourite Golden Age of Detection series. - Peterg23.

#1. Whose Body [1923], 5 hours 35 mins


#2. Clouds of Witness [1926], 8 hours 12 mins


#3. Unnatural Death [1927], 7 hours 50 mins


#4. Lord Peter Views the Body [1928] , 9 hours 17 mins


#5. The Unpleasantness at the Bellona Club [1928], 7 hours 3 mins


#6. Strong Poison [1930], 7 hours 36 mins


#7. The Five Red Herrings [1931], 10 hours 27 mins (read by Patrick Malahide)

.
#8. Have His Carcase [1932], 13 hours 47 mins


#9. Hangman's Holiday [1933], 6 hours 33 mins


#10. Murder Must Advertise [1933], 10 hours 6 mins (from cassette tapes)


#11. The Nine Tailors [1934], 10 hours 35 mins


#12. Gaudy Night [1935], 15 hours 37 mins


#13. Busman's Honeymoon [1937], 12 hours 44 mins


#14. In The Teeth of the Evidence [1939], 8 hours 16 mins


#15. Striding Folly [1972], 2 hours 7 mins



Enjoy and Seed!!
